intro: Hemipilia dolichocentra, commonly known as the long-stalked hemipilia, is a rare and delicate orchid species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale green to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and a unique inflorescence that bears several clustered flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hemipilia dolichocentra is considered a species of conservation concern.
